item.title: First steps in R
item.description: In this post we will learn about the basic syntax of R. The syntax basically refers to the grammatical rules you must adhere to when communicating with your computer in the language R: if you you do not follow the right syntax, i.e. you ‘speak’ gramatically incorrect, your computer will not understand you and communicate this to you by throwing up an error message. To learn about these important basics, the post follows the following structure:

item.title: Fundamental object types in R I: Functions
item.description: Overview We already learned (LINK) that everything in R that exists is an object. You most likely already noted that there are different types of objects: 2, for instance, was a number, but assign was a function.^[In fact, we will learn below that 2 is not really a number, but a vector or length 1. Only in a next step, 2 counts as a ‘number’, or, more precisely as a ‘double’.
